heading: IEE767A SEVERE BUFFER SHORTAGE FOR SYSTEM LOG - 100% FULL
content:
Explanation

  The system found that the system log task (SYSLOG) may be active and that
  100% of its buffers are full.

  System action

  Write-to-log (WTL) processing ceases to allocate WTL queue elements.
  Subsequent WTL requests result in a return code of 4 to the user.

  Operator response

  Increase the number of WTL buffers available to the system by entering the
  CONTROL M,LOGLIM=xxxxxx command.

  System programmer response

  Before the next system initialization, increase the value of LOGLIM in the
  CONSOLxx member of parmlib. This will allow for a higher number of
  outstanding WTL buffers.

  If your system is a JES3 system, you will need a higher default for the
  LOGLIM parameter. See the z/OS MVS Initialization and Tuning Reference for
  more information.

  Source

  Master Scheduler

  Module

  IEEMB804

  Routing code

  2,10

  Descriptor code

  2
